alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 20 at 2:48PM MST until February 21 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING FROM 7 AM TO 8 PM MST TUESDAY FOR THE NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND WARM...DRY AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS... .Stronger downslope winds will impact the eastern plains Tuesday, aided by a deepening lee side trough. Although humidity is not forecast to reach critical threshold, a warm, dry and unstable atmosphere is forecast and after the past few days of drying downslope winds, fine fuels should be supportive of carrying fire. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 8 PM MST TUESDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 7 AM to 8 PM MST Tuesday. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains (zone 104) and the East Central Plains (zone 126) from Tuesday morning into Tuesday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West to southwest 25 to 35 mph with occasional gusts to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...18 to 25 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
